channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How childbearing choices have changed across three generations in one family
item.description: Fewer women are having children than a few generations ago. Sarah McCammon talks with three generations of women in one Atlanta family to understand how opportunities and choices have changed.
item.content:encoded: Fewer women are having children than a few generations ago. Sarah McCammon talks with three generations of women in one Atlanta family to understand how opportunities and choices have changed.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Parts of Florida receive rare snowfall as freezing temperatures linger
item.description: Snow has fallen in Florida for the second year in a row.
item.content:encoded:
Snow has fallen in Florida for the second year in a row.

(Image credit: Chris O'Meara)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: U.S. military troops on standby for possible deployment to Minnesota
item.description: The move comes after President Trump again threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act to control ongoing protests over the immigration enforcement surge in Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded:
The move comes after President Trump again threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act to control ongoing protests over the immigration enforcement surge in Minneapolis.

(Image credit: Octavio Jones)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: The latest from Minnesota after Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act
item.description: Governor Tim Walz has readied the state National Guard to help law enforcement as protests continue across Minneapolis. President Trump has threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act.
item.content:encoded: Governor Tim Walz has readied the state National Guard to help law enforcement as protests continue across Minneapolis. President Trump has threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: San Francisco is set to lose a historic fountain, beloved by its skate community
item.description: San Francisco is planning a renovation that would destroy one of the city's distinguishing features: a fountain that became iconic to the skate scene in the 1980s and '90s.
item.content:encoded: San Francisco is planning a renovation that would destroy one of the city's distinguishing features: a fountain that became iconic to the skate scene in the 1980s and '90s.
item.dc:creator: Katie DeBenedetti

item.title: Amid ICE clashes, New Hampshire bishop urges clergy to prepare their wills
item.description: The Episcopal bishop of New Hampshire told priests protesting ICE to get their wills and affairs in order. Some praise the bishop, while other priests say they never signed up to be martyrs.
item.content:encoded:
The Episcopal bishop of New Hampshire told priests protesting ICE to get their wills and affairs in order. Some praise the bishop, while other priests say they never signed up to be martyrs.

(Image credit: Elena Eberwein/NHPR)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: New York Giants hire John Harbaugh as coach after identifying him as their top choice
item.description: Harbaugh joins the Giants 11 days after he was fired by the Baltimore Ravens. The Super Bowl champion is now tasked with turning around a beleaguered franchise.
item.content:encoded:
Harbaugh joins the Giants 11 days after he was fired by the Baltimore Ravens. The Super Bowl champion is now tasked with turning around a beleaguered franchise.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Escalating tensions in Minnesota
item.description: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded: Tensions continue to escalate in Minnesota as the state continues to be the center of the administration's immigration crackdown. NPR's Jasmine Garsd reports from Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: NASA's Artemis II craft meets the launch pad ahead of crewed lunar orbit
item.description: Mission Artemis plans to send Americans to the moon for the first time since the Nixon administration.
item.content:encoded:
Mission Artemis plans to send Americans to the moon for the first time since the Nixon administration.

(Image credit: Derek Demeter)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Many in Minneapolis prepare for the holiday weekend. Here's what's happening
item.description: Protests against a surge of federal immigration officers into the city are continuing, while the threat of President Trump invoking the Insurrection Act hangs in the air.
item.content:encoded: Protests against a surge of federal immigration officers into the city are continuing, while the threat of President Trump invoking the Insurrection Act hangs in the air.
item.dc:creator: Eric Westervelt
